description: This full, ripe wine is rich with black fruits as well as firm, young tannins. It has weight, spice, black-cherry flavors and a solid structure that needs plenty of aging. Drink from 2023.

title: Amayna 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: Aromas of orange, lemon peel, fresh greens and the ocean are clear, clean and in harmony. A tangy, crisp palate is braced by a shot of blazing acidity, while this tastes mostly of lime and salt from the nearby Pacific Ocean. A steady finish is showing the slightest bit of yeasty breakdown, so drink as soon as possible.

title: Barrelhouse 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Relatively light body comes with terrific, fresh fruit flavors and good balance in this appealing and straightforward wine. Raspberry and cherry waft up from the glass and equally exuberant fruit flavors fill this wine out nicely.

title: Biondi 2016 Contrada San Nicolò  (Etna)
description: Made with Nerello Mascalese and Nerello Cappuccio, this offers subtle, earthy aromas evoking red berry, moist soil, exotic spice and a whiff of white pepper. The ethereal palate is a bit on the lean side, offering pomegranate and a hint of clove alongside firm acidity and lithe tannins. Drink 2020–2024.

title: Bolshoi 2016 Estelle Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This bottling by a winemaker originally from Moldova offers well-integrated aromas of black plum, subtle licorice and sweet herbs on the nose. The palate is polished and carries flavors of fresh berries, wild mint and anise, proving fruity but balanced.

title: Bortomiol 2017 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)
description: Heady scents of honeysuckle, wisteria and white stone fruit waft out of the glass. On the foaming palate, fresh acidity brightens ripe Granny Smith apple and white peach, while a confectionery note clings to the finish.

title: Catalina Sounds 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine shows a strong line of green herb, tomato leaf and nettle characters, with tropical fruit in the background. Some oak fermentation, lees work and partial skin contact make for a more textural style, with lifted acidity and a slight flinty quality neatly round things out.

title: Cave de Viré 2017 Grande Réserve  (Viré-Clessé)
description: Lightly mineral in texture, this wine has rich concentration. Rich yellow fruits and crisp apple are coupled together with ripe fruitiness and finished with acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Cebada 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Reduced cherry and cranberry aromas meet with wild mint and fennel on the nose of this bottling. There is compelling structure on the palate, where boiled red-cherry and cranberry flavors and lifted by bay leaf and oregano.

title: Château Brûle Sécaille 2015 Grande Réserve  (Côtes de Bourg)
description: This ripe, rounded wine is just setting out on the aging process. Still showing its wood-aging spice, it also has black-currant fruits and balanced acidity. It will develop well over the next few years and should be ready to drink from 2021.

title: Château Coucy 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: Rich black-currant fruits mingle with dusty, dry tannins in this young wine. A ripe, jammy character comes from the 85% Merlot in the blend. Fruity and lifted by acidity, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2021.

title: Château de Cérons 2016 Château Calvimont  (Graves)
description: Sémillon from a vineyard that can also make sweet botrytized wines will always have a touch of honey. That's true of this rich, creamy wine. With its floral character and lemon flavors, this dry wine is young with a good potential. Drink from 2020.

title: Château de Ribebon 2015 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This luscious, ripe wine is full of blackberry flavors and rich tannins. It is still young, but its fruits and generous texture already give it a delicious character. With another year it will be ready to drink, so plan on late 2019.

title: Château du Claouset 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: While the wood flavors are prominent at this stage, this wine also has fruit weight. The blueberry fruitiness comes through, allowing this ripe wine to balance out. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Féret-Lambert 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: At this stage, this wine is all about tannins. That will change as the weight of the black fruits comes through to give a complex, rich wine with good potential. Drink from 2022.

title: Col Vetoraz 2017  Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze
description: This foaming sparkler opens with heady aromas of honeysuckle and green apple that follow on to the palate together with white peach and candied lemon drop. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.

title: Concha y Toro 2017 Marques de Casa Concha Coastal Vineyard Chardonnay (Limarí Valley)
description: Dusty white fruit aromas are lightly oaked, and overall this smells like what good Chardonnay should smell like. A medium-bodied palate blends fresh acidity with resiny oak, while flavors of oak, vanilla, butter and white fruit ring true. A clean finish with modest latent acidity and oak is a good conclusion.
designation: Marques de Casa Concha Coastal Vineyard

title: Cordier 2016 Château d'Haurets  (Bordeaux)
description: Rich, structured and generous, this wine has great potential. Its firm tannins don't mask the juicy black-currant and blueberry fruits and acidity. Drink from 2021.

title: Domaine Massin 2014 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)
description: A deliciously mature wine, this is ripe with yellow fruits that are softening, showing secondary flavors of hazelnuts over the acidity and minerality. This rich wine is ready to drink.

title: Dorigo NV Brut Cuvée Sparkling (Vino Spumante)
description: Lemon, golden apple, pencil lead and toast aromas follow over to the soft palate along with citrus, a dollop of vanilla and a hint of hazelnut. An airy perlage accompanies the rich flavors.

title: Fiddletown Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)
description: Chalky aromas and flavors distinguish this bone-dry, refreshing and different wine. It's light in body, light on ripe fruit flavors but brings out the mineral, saline and citrus flavors that many wine drinkers love.

title: Corte Moschina 2014 Brut Metodo Classico Durella (Veneto)
description: Aromas of hazelnut, yellow peach and orange flavored liqueur carry over to the racy palate along with bitter yellow apple skin. A refined perlage lends softness and vibrancy.

title: Domaine Antonin Guyon 2016 Premier Cru  (Meursault)
description: This wine is ripe, toasty and textured, with a nervy edge that gives it balance. The wine will age further, so drink from 2020.

title: Domaine du Roc des Boutires 2016  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: Smooth and with a rounded character, this warm wine fully reflects the ripe vintage. Its soft texture makes it very full in the mouth and it misses out on some necessary freshness. Drink the wine now.

title: Emilio Moro 2016 El Zarzal Godello (Bierzo)
description: A gold-meets-tan color and chunky aromas of walnut oil and mature apple are less than overtly fruity and fresh. In the mouth, citric acidity is keeping this braced and balanced. Flavors of lightly salty nectarine and peach pit turn lemony and a touch bitter on a full finish. Drink now.

title: Fillaboa 2017 Estate Grown Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Melon and mild pyrazine-based green aromas create a good but slightly unfocused nose. This feels chunky and pulpy, with melony weight. Flavors of pineapple and nectarine are briny on the back end, while this is short on a finish that's low on acidic verve.

title: Koyle 2015 Royale Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Hard-edged aromas of mint, dark spice and earthy berry fruit are woodsy. A tight, rugged palate is saturated but rough. Flavors of minty black fruit and oak spice finish aggressively, with some heat.

title: Kula 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Somewhat delicate on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of kirsch and spice cake to start. It lands softly on the palate, with mouth-coating flavors of strawberry and sharp cinnamon, with a pinch of dried herbs.

title: Kynsi 2017 Barn Owl Blush Rosé (Edna Valley)
description: Rich aromas of red plum, vanilla and wet stone show on the nose of this bottling from Pinot Noir grapes. Cherry and nutmeg flavors show on the warm palate.

title: Le Bertarole 2013 Podere Cariano  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, dark fruit and leather lead the nose. The robust palate delivers prune, vanilla and nutmeg alongside close-grained tannins.

title: Marisco Vineyards 2017 The Ned Pinot Gris (Marlborough)
description: Left for a spell on the skins, this pink-hued Pinot Gris could be easily mistaken for a rosé. Delicate and refreshing, aromas of strawberry, peach and mango follow from the nose to the palate. This is a clean, crisp and highly likable wine.

title: Messina Hof 2016 Private Reserve Double Barrel Tempranillo (Texas High Plains)
description: An earthy nose of lush green moss, ferns and tilled earth carries a subtle hint of wild blackberry. The palate is more fruit driven, offering cherry, raspberry and plum flavors that are supported by a backbone of a savory earth note and gritty tannins. It finishes with a spicy pepper tone.

title: Migration 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made of grapes sourced from several vineyards, including a few that the producer uses in single bottlings, this is a round and rich wine tasting of custard, vanilla and sweet pineapple.

title: Nicosia 2017 Vulkà  (Etna)
description: A blend of 80% Nerello Mascalese and 20% Nerello Cappuccio, this has inviting aromas of dark-skinned berry, culinary spice, blue flower and a whiff of charred earth. It's smooth, easygoing and juicy, offering fleshy black cherry, blackberry and a hint of clove alongside pliant, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Olivini 2011 Diciannove Marzo Pas Dosé  (Lugana)
description: Aromas of toast and yeasty bread dough take center stage. The racy, vivacious palate offers yellow apple, roasted coffee bean, chopped dill and lemon zest alongside firm acidity and a lively perlage.

title: Olivini 2012 Brut Metodo Classico  (Lugana)
description: Spring field flower, white stone fruit, toast and a whiff of bread crust waft out of the glass. The linear, rather lean palate offers mature yellow apple, bitter almond and orange rind alongside tangy acidity.

title: Paul Cheneau NV Lady of Spain Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny lime aromas are slightly yeasty but mostly clean and fresh. A citrusy palate maintains clarity and freshness, while this tastes of green apple and lime in front of a steady, pleasant finish. Add a point for the cool packaging, if that's your thing.

title: Pech Merle 2015 T-Bar-T Ranch Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)
description: Aromatically shy, in contrast to its showy tannins, this wine is huge in structure and weight, with a jammy core of black cherry and raspberry dusted in clove.

title: Peregrine 2016 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)
description: A little oniony, salty and reductive at the start, with some swirls in glass this wine offers delicate aromas of lemon and lime. Typical to this variety and style, its texture is creamy, woven nicely between crunchy—if a little austere—acidity and a salty bitter-almond finish. On the premium end both in price and style, this is one for the dinner table rather than for sipping solo.

title: Producta Vignobles 2016 Château Moulin de Lagut  (Bordeaux)
description: This balanced wine has both firm tannins and rich fruit. They are beginning to come together to give a full, structured wine, packed with bold black flavors. Drink from 2021.

title: Rod McDonald Wines 2016 Mister Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)
description: This Hawke's Bay Chardonnay offers up a nose of citrus fruit and mango rind. These notes lead onto a medium-bodied palate of tongue tingling, citrusy acidity and some fruit weight. There's a little bitterness on the finish.

title: Univitis 2017 Château les Vergnes  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: The Muscadelle in this wine makes it so attractive. It gives it a perfumed character, as well as enhancing the lively citrus fruits. Lightly herbal, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Gambino 2015 Tifeo Rosso  (Etna)
description: This has aromas of French oak, prune, underbrush and vanilla. Reflecting the nose, the lean, light-bodied palate evokes coconut, espresso and a hint of dried berry alongside dusty, rather fleeting tannins that leave a drying, astringent finish.

title: Auclair 2016 96 Cedars Red (Red Mountain)
description: This wine is a blend of 38% Merlot, 31% Cabernet Franc, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Petit Verdot. Aromas of dried cherry and baking spice lead to tangy, somewhat green seeming fruit flavors that drop off on the finish.

title: Binz 2016 Barbera (Sierra Foothills)
description: This medium-bodied wine shows a lot of oak influence in the baking-spice aromas, cedar and vanilla flavors and spicy finish. Under the oak are bright raspberry and cherry flavors.

title: Bodega Volcanes de Chile 2016 Tectonia Chardonnay (Malleco)
description: Fully toasted oak aromas are smoky and grainy, and they cover up briny apple notes. A mix of oily weight and sharp acidity defines the palate, while this tastes a bit sour, with lots of oak attached to stone fruit flavors. Hailing from southerly Malleco, this is a cool-climate Chardonnay, and thus the high acid level makes sense.

title: Caricature 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Clarksburg)
description: Obvious oak aromas and an almost sweet sensation on the palate give this wine a sense of wearing plenty of makeup. The texture is broad and soft, and the flavors are like candied cherries.

title: Carminucci 2015 Naumakos  (Rosso Piceno)
description: Made with 70% Montepulciano and 30% Sangiovese, this has aromas of prune, raisin and tilled soil. The rather evolved palate offers dried cherry, vanilla and star anise alongside rounded tannins.

title: Casa Donoso 2017 Bicentenario Gran Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)
description: Aggressive aromas of gamy berry fruits are slightly green. Tough, choppy tannins make the palate gritty, while this tastes of robust black fruit, tomato sauce and green herb. A punchy finish reverberates with hard tannins.

title: Château Bel Air La Perrière 2016  Bordeaux
description: This wine is structured and firm, with dark tannins and a core of smoky, bitter flavors. Let this wine rest for the potential of its black fruits to shine. Drink from 2021.

title: Château La Gabarre 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Bright red cherries and raspberries shine out of this attractive, light and jammy wine. Its tannins are well behaved behind all this fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2021.

title: Château Lagrave Paran 2011 Cuvée Geraldine  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This wine is beginning to brown at the edges, indicating its age. This cuvée is mature although, typically for this vintage, it has not lost its tannins. Drink now, although it will have a tough edge.

title: Château Le Bonalguet 2016  Bordeaux
description: This smoky, meaty wine offers solid tannins and high-toast, burnt flavors. Luckily the fruit is there and should shine through the structure as the wine develops. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Maison Noble 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Firm and closed, this wine has a way to go. Solid tannins dominate and there is a strong sense of extraction and bitterness. The wine should soften, although the tannins will remain. Don't drink before 2022.

title: Chilensis 2017 Reserva Estate Bottled Carmenère (Maule Valley)
description: Spicy, foresty, slightly damp black fruit aromas are normal for basic Carmenère. A solid palate with acidic snap is healthy. Generic berry and spice flavors are a bit green, while this is saucy tasting on the finish.

title: Clotilde Davenne 2015 Cuvée Plaisir  (Mâcon-Villages)
description: Bright, crisp and ready to drink, this is a lively wine. It has plenty of apple and citrus flavors as well as a more mature edge of almonds. Drink now.

title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2016 Tradition  (Mâcon-Chardonnay)
description: Textured while also rich, this rounded wine is generous and lightly spicy. The smooth texture gives the wine extra weight. Drink now.

title: Domaines Devillard 2016 Le Renard  (Givry)
description: Soft and fruity with an attractive blend of cherry fruits and acidity, this wine is perfumed and developing well. Its fruitiness is lightly supported by tannins that are just softening. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Esser 2016 Merlot (Monterey County)
description: Red cherry and turned earth show on the simple but clean nose of this bottling. Tart red fruit and more dusty qualities show on the sip, with a hint of vanilla on the finish.

title: Esser 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Cut grass and pungent green-apple slices make for a familiar entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate starts with Granny Smith apple and nectarine flavors, but they are short-lived and the texture is flat.

title: Estampa 2017 Fina Reserva La Isla Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Viognier White (Marchigue)
description: Minerally citrus aromas break down and veer off toward lanolin and sea-foam. This Sauvignon Blanc (with other white grapes) has grip, but that's fleeting. Briny, salty citrus flavors are crisp before fading fast on a dilute finish.
designation: Fina Reserva La Isla Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Viognier

title: Château Guibonnet 2017  Côtes de Bourg
description: This rich wine has some firm tannins as well as generous black fruits. It is balanced, with the crisp acidity coming through strongly. Pepper and pure fruit flavors finish this attractive wine.

title: Château Larroque 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Firmly tannic with a dusty texture, this wine is also rich in spicy black fruits and balanced with acidity. It has plenty of potential, with rich tannins and good acidity at the end. Drink from 2021.

title: Château l'Orangerie 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: A warm wine with ripe fruits and rich acidity, this is a blend of crisp Sauvignon Blanc with smoother Sémillon. This fruity wine is now ready to drink.

title: Château Suau 2016  Côtes de Bordeaux
description: This fresh, fruity wine from organic grapes offers attractive red fruits and a backing of tannins. The dry core and the attractive fruits are coming together well, leaving a lively wine that will be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Concha y Toro 2016 Marques de Casa Concha Carmenère (Peumo)
description: Earthy, floral blackberry aromas are spicy and herbal in a way that's familiar to Carmenère. A fleshy palate with tomatoey acidity is strong but not overly tough. Herbal, minty olive and black plum flavors are spicy prior to a rumbling finish.

title: Domaine Chenevières 2017 Ica-Onna  (Saint-Bris)
description: A perfumed wine from the small region west of Chablis, this is a tropical-fruit-flavored wine. Its light texture and freshness give it a lively, crisp character. Drink now.

title: Domaine Dujardin 2015 Beaux Fougets  (Beaune)
description: Softly textured with ripe red fruits, this wine has layers of tannins as well as spicy wood-aging flavors. But the main thrust is full and generous fruit. Drink from 2022.

title: Dominio de Requena NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Fresh white fruit aromas of apple and pear include a hint of pine needle. This Cava from the Requena section of Valencia keeps it simple on the palate, so this ranks as an easy drinker. Standard white fruit flavors are clean and friendly.

title: Etude 2017 Grace Benoist Ranch Pinot Gris (Carneros)
description: This is a light, floral white that takes on medium-bodied weight and ripeness on the midpalate. Jasmine and apple highlight a viscous finish.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Riesling (Santa Barbara County)
description: There's a pleasing petrol character on the nose of this medium-sweet bottling, along with grapefruit and orange peels and rainy cement. There's a flash of sweetness on the palate, with pear syrup and orange-blossom flavors.

title: Folie à Deux 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Thick, woody and flavored in anise, mango and pear, this is an approachable, attractively priced and well-made wine that will work well with food or on its own.

title: Gård 2015 Grand Klasse Reserve Lawrence Vineyards Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of barrel spice, creamsicle and flower lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors and a warm finish. The oak influence seems a bit overweighted for the fruit in the bottle.

title: Gen5 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine has plenty of plummy flavors and a spicy streak of black pepper and smoke running through it from the aroma to the finish. It's smooth in texture, moderately concentrated and is 100% estate grown, very rare for a wine this inexpensive.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2017 Laurent Dufouleur Cuvée Grégoire  (Bourgogne)
description: A fruity wine with youthful acidity and bright-cherry flavors, this is simply structured, with just a touch of dry tannin. Drink now.

title: Locations NV TX6 Red (Texas)
description: Tart blackberry and fresh-picked raspberry mix with an undertow of tanned leather and cedar on the nose. Juicy acidity balances the crushed velvet tannins, housing flavors of ripe blueberry, blackberry and plum that are accented by vanilla, baking spice and balsam. The vanilla and blackberry finish is luscious and plummy.

title: Marcel Couturier 2016 Le Clos Reyssié  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: Bright, fresh and crisp, this wine is textured and fruity. It has a strong mineral edge as well as good acidity. Drink this wine now.

title: Marchetti 2016 Tenuta del Cavaliere  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)
description: This opens with delicate aromas of acacia flower and toasted almond. The aromas carry over to the linear palate along with citrus notes and white peach. Drink soon.

title: Mark West 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This affordable wine is a little obvious in terms of oaky spices in the aroma and flavors, but it backs them up with good cherry and berry flavors to complete the package. It's medium bodied and smooth in texture.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry aromas are matched by spicy oak and vanilla notes. In the mouth, this warm-vintage crianza feels snappy, sappy and sinewy. Oaky red plum and currant flavors finish spicy but basic. Overall, this is a good but standard Rioja, nothing more.

title: Meiomi 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey County-Sonoma County-Santa Barbara County)
description: Obvious oak spices including cedar, clove, cinnamon and wood char fill the aroma of this medium-bodied, extroverted wine and continue in the flavors, giving a sweet edge to the fruit component.

title: Albatross Ridge 2015 Cuvée Vivienne Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling from a dramatic vineyard atop the Carmel Valley shows light pomegranate, tart red-fruit and sarsaparilla aromas on the nose. The palate is quite tangy and tart with raspberry, cranberry, fennel frond and nutmeg flavors.

title: Barberani 2014 Passito Moscato (Umbria)
description: Made with dried Moscato grapes, this savory dessert wine opens with aromas of dried apricot and candied lemon that carry over to the elegant palate, with rosemary honey and toasted almond. It's well balanced with a long finish.

title: Barra of Mendocino 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: Full flavored, well structured and well balanced, this is a handsome wine that carries its ample black-cherry and blackberry flavors on a muscular frame of fine-grained tannins and full body. The natural, concentrated grape flavors come shining through with little obvious oakiness to get in the way.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Laztana Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy, savory aromas include notes of cured meat, dried leaves and red berries. A solid palate is grabby but in shape. Leafy, earthy flavors of roasted plum and berry fruits end with peppery spice notes and a lasting sense of dryness. Drink this by-the-book reserva through 2024.

title: Château Haut Boutisse 2015  Saint-Émilion
description: A small parcel on the Palais Cardinal estate on the plain of Saint-Émilion is treated and bottled separately. The result is a generous wine with balanced tannins and ripe berry fruits. It is a warm wine with a crisp edge. Drink from 2021.

title: Collin-Bourisset 2017  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: Rich and full, this wine offers apricot and creamed-apple flavors shot through with tight acidity. It is deliciously full, juicy and certain to age well. Drink from 2019.

title: D.R. Stephens 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Thick and rich in baked plum and toffee flavors, this is a robust, well-made wine that is integrated, supple and pleasantly direct in focus and flavor.

title: Domaine Chenevières 2016 L'Homme Mort Premier Cru  (Chablis)
description: This rich, soft wine is very approachable. A honeyed edge balances the crisp texture and ripe apples. The wine comes from one of the more northerly of the premier crus, but it has a southerly expression that gives the warm fruit in this wine. Drink from 2020.

title: Domaine de Cabasse 2016 Juncunditas  (Gigondas)
description: Plush, primary blackberry and plum flavors abound in this full-bodied, fruit-forward wine. It's soft and sensual in texture, with fine, feathery tannins and soft acidity. Its juicy fruit flavors are ready to enjoy now but should gain savory complexity through 2026.

title: Domaine de la Verde 2015 Prélude Red (Vacqueyras)
description: Prélude is this producer's entry-level red. But unadorned by oak, it's a transparent and luminous expression of pristine black fruit and heady floral perfume. Cherry and plum flavors are lusciously concentrated, accented by violet, spice and baked earth. A silky yet briskly balanced wine with fine, integrated tannins that extend on the finish. Enjoy now–2026.

title: Domaine Fourrey 2017 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)
description: Full and rich, this generous wine comes from one of the sunniest Premier Crus in Chablis. It offers warmth, ripe white fruits and lime flavors along with a spicy texture. The wine's richness is already enjoyable but it will be better from 2020.

title: Domaine la Garrigue 2015 La Cantarelle Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: Intensely concentrated yet nuanced by earth, spice and flower, this powerful wine originates from 80- to 100-year-old vines of Grenache and Syrah. Luscious blackberry and cherry flavors are persistent and punchy, balanced by crisp acidity and soft, silky tannins. Enjoyable now for its vibrant fruit but should improve through 2026.

title: Dubl NV Brut Metodo Classico Falanghina (Vino Spumante)
description: Wildflower, Mediterranean brush and citrus aromas lead the way. The juicy palate delivers lemon zest, pear and crushed stone alongside fresh acidity and an elegant perlage.

title: Easton 2016 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Smooth and creamy yet firm enough for good grip, this is a big but well-balanced wine that offers plenty of ripe berries and plums along with hints of black pepper and sage. Moderate tannins seem to build on the palate and add a good bite to the finish.

title: Fern Ridge 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine gushes in tones of lime popsicle and guava flecked with honey. The juicy fruit continues on the palate, where tangy, bouncy acidity sits easily alongside a creamy texture. There's a long peach and lime finish.

title: Fontaine du Clos 2015 Pince Lapin Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: Power and elegance calibrate neatly in this blend of 70% Grenache and 30% Syrah grapes. Juicy black cherry and plum flavors are plush and richly concentrated but maintain a freshness of acidity and zesty mineral tang. Mouthfilling and silky, it finishes long on fine but penetrating tannins. Enjoy now–2028.

title: Framingham 2017 Nobody's Hero Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Guava, pineapple rind, red apple skins and green herbs lead the nose. The grapefruit-tinged palate is threaded together with prickly, mouthwatering acidity, chalky wet-stone minerality and a long, juicy and spicy finish.

title: Giornata 2016 Il Campo Rosso Red (Paso Robles)
description: Light in the glass, this extremely quaffable twist top table wine is perfect for a wide range of foods and casual sipping, showing easy aromas of strawberry, baking spice and gravel on the nose. The palate is fresh with framboise, red plum, orange rind and white pepper, offering great complexity in a lightweight package.

title: J. Coudray Bizot 2012 En Orveaux  (Echézeaux)
description: Surprisingly mature both in color and flavor for a wine from such a prestigious vineyard, this wine has almost passed its best. Secondary flavors are very present along with a touch of mature dryness. Drink now.

title: Joseph Drouhin 2015  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: A ripe wine from a fine vintage, this is full of rich red-berry fruits, tannins and balanced acidity. It is still young, although all the elements for an excellent wine are in place. Let the tannins soften and drink from 2021.

title: Decibel 2016 Crownthorpe Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)
description: This wine is all about subtle stone fruit, white spice and floral characters. The acidity is a little on the harsh side, but it's just barely kept in check by a chalky yet mouthwatering palate.

title: Domaine Chamfort 2015 Les 2 Louis Grenache-Mourvèdre (Vacqueyras)
description: A 50-50 blend of Grenache and Mourvèdre, this is a plush and easy-drinking wine offering generous black cherry and plum flavor. Full bodied, soft and edged by fine, integrated tannins, it's approachable already and should drink well through 2023.

title: Domaine Chenevières 2017  Chablis
description: Produced by the Brocard family, one of the larger vineyard owners in Chablis, this wine comes from one of the most northerly villages in the region. It is crisp and lemony, with touches of yellow fruits. A bright while rich wine, it is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2017 Authentique  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: Round and fruity, this generous wine has ripe apple and crisp citrus flavors in a good balance. The texture shows it is still young, but it will fill out well. Drink from 2019.

title: Doren 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Reduced on the nose, this 100% varietal wine is brawny in smoke, tar and espresso. Its fruit components are subtle and nuanced, a light mingling of cherry vanilla and red currant.

title: Dourthe 2016 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux)
description: Full and rich, this wine has weight and good potential. The tannins are firm, solid and dense with a dry core, but surrounded by generous fruit and acidity. Drink from 2020.

title: Easton 2017 Lot 1852 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This is a smooth relaxed wine that's easy to sip and enjoy without having to fight high alcohol or tight tannins. It has a relatively light color, plenty of plum and sour-cherry flavors and medium to full body.

title: Eberle 2016 Eberle Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: A bit shy in aromas at first, this bottling slowly opens up toward blackberry and caramel scents with patience. The palate is densely structured, putting texture at the forefront, with flavors of black plum and pepper arising toward the finish.

title: Felsina NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Vino Spumante)
description: A blend of 50% Sangiovese, 30% Pinot Noir and 20% Chardonnay, this sparkler has subdued aromas of toast, wild herb and a whiff of orchard fruit. On the palate, a lively perlage wraps around dried sour cherry, bitter almond and a citrus zest note.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2016  Mâcon-Villages
description: A smooth, ripe wine with great fruit and soft texture, this wine sums up the rich 2016 vintage. Hints of yellow fruits, acidity and honey are all there. This is an attractive wine to drink now.

title: Hawley 2016 Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Strong in red fruit and clove and light in tannin and oak, this is a robust wine that remains soft on the palate.

title: It's a Headsnapper 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a delicate, dainty Sauvignon that glides onto the scene with lime, red apple peel and blossoms. Texturally, it's a little chalky, with an apple-focused tang, balanced acidity and a mouthwatering finish.

title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2016 Château London  (Mâcon-Igé)
description: This is a crisp wine, full of bright acidity and with a nice touch of honey to make it richer. A hint of minerality adds to the attractive texture of this ripe and fresh wine. Drink now.

title: Josh Cellars 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Fleshy and lush in baked apple, pear and fig, this wine has a balanced backbone of acidity that gives it a freshness around the fruit. It seriously overdelivers on price.

title: Junta 2017 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)
description: Earthy berry and plum aromas are fruity and clean enough to earn a positive rating. This Cabernet feels crisp and snappy, and maybe a touch scratchy. Plum, berry and currant flavors don't rise to a level of elegance or complexity, but overall this is tasty, fresh and balanced.

title: Juvé & Camps 2015 Milesimé Brut Reserva Chardonnay (Cava)
description: Dusty, dry apple and pear aromas come with a whiff of talcum powder. This Chardonnay feels plump and soft, with moderate to low acidity. Apple, vanilla and spiced pear flavors are steady on a finish that's more regular than special.

title: Krásná Hora 2015 Cuvée Bernety Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon (Moravia)
description: This cuvée is made using 60% Merlot and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon. The aromas of black cherry, tart cherry and black plum transfer seamlessly to the palate.

title: Lawrelin 2005 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: That vintage is not a typo. This newly released wine is a full 13 years old. Subdued aromas of dried cherry, licorice and spice. The fruit flavors have started to fade, but there are still a lot of interesting things going on, particularly on the finish. Drink now.

title: Le Preare 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, clove and underbrush come together on this brawny red. The firm palate delivers ripe black plum, star anise and clove alongside chewy tannins.

title: Domaine de Coyeux 2007 Les Cavares Red (Beaumes-de-Venise)
description: Whiffs of earth, cacao and garrigue accent intensely ripe blackberry perfume in this sultry, full-bodied red. It's velvety and potent yet not at all confected. Vine, gentle tannins and fresh acidity extend on the finish. Enjoy now–2026.

title: Domaine de Coyeux 2013 Thétys Red (Beaumes-de-Venise)
description: High-altitude vineyards and a sunny southern exposition lend both power and freshness to this crisp but full-bodied red. It's a juicy, supple wine offering a generous bounty of summer plum and strawberry flavors. Tangy mineral notes lend vibrance to a moderately long, softly tannic finish. Enjoy now–2025.

title: Domaine Les Semelles de Vent 2015 Vieilles Vignes Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: Ripe but restrained black plum and boysenberry flavors are edged with graphite, thyme and lavender in this full-bodied blend of Grenache and Syrah. Sourced from vines ranging from 40 to 70 years old, it's concentrated and framed by firm, gripping tannins. Still youthful, it could improve well through 2030.

title: Dorigo NV Blanc de Blancs Pas Dosé Metodo Classico Sparkling (Vino Spumante)
description: Spring flower, orchard fruit and a hint of tropical fruit mingle with bread crust aromas. On the vibrant palate, bright acidity offsets juicy pineapple, white peach and tangerine zest before the dry finish. An elegant mousse lends finesse.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Pas Dosé Metodo Classico

title: Eberle 2016 Steinbeck Vineyard Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: There's a tarry backbone to the nose of this bottling, but there's also ample blackberry fruit, peppercorn, roasted meat and crushed violet aromas. The palate is intense in more tar, meat and peppercorn flavors, which result in a savory, medium-bodied mouthfeel.

title: Giornata 2016 French Camp Vineyard Aglianico (Paso Robles)
description: Bright aromas of blueberry meet with earthy aromas and a tannic tension on the nose of this bottling, which comes from a vineyard deep in the southeastern corner of Paso Robles. A firm structure carries plummy flavors on the palate, which is relatively light on its feet, approachable and easy to like.

title: Jermann 2017 Pinot Grigio (Friuli)
description: Honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas lead the nose of this savory white. Smooth and juicy, the enveloping palate doles out honeydew melon, cantaloupe and baking spice alongside a hint of tangy citrus.

title: Kula 2017 Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Light and clean with even aromas of peach syrup, concentrated honeydew and a hint of wood, this fresh and bright bottling from a winery whose name means “gold” in Hawaiian includes 6% Picpoul Blanc. Citrusy flavors start the palate as the tropical touches linger in the background, wrapped in a racy texture with lots of zing into the finish.

title: La Grand Comtadine 2016  Gigondas
description: This creamy, deeply textured blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre ripples on the palate with sumptuous layers of blueberry and plum. It's a rounded, welcoming wine framed by supple tannins and sunny acidity. Hedonistic and slightly warming, it's a fruity sip to enjoy now–2023.

title: Laurent Cognard 2016 Clos du Vieux Château Premier Cru  (Montagny)
description: Now deliciously ready to drink, this ripe wine has touches of wood toast as well as smooth yellow fruits. It has a warm feel that still keeps minerality and acidity in play. Drink this rich wine from 2019.
designation: Clos du Vieux Château Premier Cru

title: Old Ghost 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Ripe fruit flavors, a firm texture and generous spicy oak make this full-bodied wine a winner. The color is deep and dark, while the bouquet emphasizes blackberry and blueberry aromas that segue to a palate of baking spices and concentrated berries.

title: Parducci 2016 Small Lot Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: Generous in dark-fruit flavors and rounded in texture, this full-bodied wine is mouthcoating in concentrated tones of black cherry and blackberry. A spicy oak note don't intrude, while this feels moderately tannic and well balanced.

title: Quivira 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a heck of a value, well-made, well-integrated and structured. Baked bread and dark-cherry flavors are supported by thick tannin and complementary high-toned acidity, the finish a rich, rewarding end note of dark chocolate and coffee.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Valsecchi Vineyard Zinfandel (Carneros)
description: This has both high-toned acidity and strong tannins, with corresponding flavors that contrast from cranberry and cherry to vanilla and fresh bread. Along the powerful midpalate are highlights of leather, dried herb and peppery oak.

title: Siduri 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Both gamy and sweet aromas show on the nose of this bottling, with cranberry, pomegranate and candied strawberry touches offset by meaty funk. The palate is lightly bodied, with long simmering acidity and herbal touches enhancing the dark strawberry core.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2016 Calderara Sottana  (Etna)
description: Aromas of menthol, French oak and dark spice take center stage. The linear, medium-bodied palate offers red cherry, crushed cranberry and star anise alongside close-grained tannins and bright acidity. A salty mineral note signals the close. Drink 2021–2028.

title: Tenuta Santa Maria 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
description: Pressed violet, allspice, baked plum and cake spice aromas lead the nose. The densely concentrated palate offers dried black cherry, star anise, clove and tobacco alongside firm, refined tannins. Drink 2019–2026.

title: Viaggio 2014 Outlaw Malbec (Lodi)
description: Aromas of black pepper and grilled beef lead to rich black-cherry and blackberry-jam flavors in this full-bodied and densely flavored wine. It has firm tannins and good acidity for a rather stiff texture that needs a bit of time to soften. Best after 2021.

title: Wente 2015 Charles Wetmore Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine has a big, spicy presence backed by a lush fruit flavor. Cedar, clove and cinnamon aromas fill the nose followed by ripe black-cherry, blackberry and dried plum flavors that are wrapped in a blanket of fine-grained tannins. The mouthfeel is generous but balanced by good acidity.

title: Union de Producteurs de Saint-Émilion 2016 Château Terre de Grand  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This ripe, bold wine is balanced and full of well-structured tannins and fruit. With concentration plus a solid and dark base of black-plum flavors, the wine has excellent potential. Drink this full wine from 2022.

title: Domaine de la Verde 2015 Òra Red (Vacqueyras)
description: Òra is the flagship bottling of Domaine de la Verde. It's more structured in acidity and concentration than the producer's basic label but less embellished than the oakier Alpha-Omega. It's full bodied and plush but balanced by tart black currant acidity and piquant notes of anise and black pepper. A juicy but elegant wine to enjoy now–2026.

title: Domaine de l'Espigouette 2015 Red (Vacqueyras)
description: Sweet-tart blackberry and plum flavors are juicy and fresh on the palate of this full-bodied red. It's unabashedly fruit forward but balanced neatly by brisk acidity and fine-grained tannins. A hint of cocoa and dried thyme lend complexity. Enjoy now–2024.

title: Domaine Gueguen 2017 Vaucoupin Premier Cru  (Chablis)
description: This rich, still-young wine displays a good balance between fruit and structure. Acidity is balanced by the ripe yellow fruits, mineral texture and rapier-like character. Drink this wine from 2020.

title: Domaine la Fourmone 2015 Les Ceps d'Or Grenache-Mourvèdre (Vacqueyras)
description: A blend of Grenache and Mourvèdre, this full-bodied wine offers ripe but restrained black currant and blackberry flavors marked by crushed mineral and herb. It's brisker and sleeker than many of the plush wines from Vacqueyras this vintage. Enjoy now–2026.

title: Domaine le Couroulu 2015 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: A blend of 70% Grenache and 30% Syrah, this full-bodied, plush wine offers ripe blackberry and mulberry flavors offset by hints of spice, bramble and coffee. It's an easy-drinking but polished red marked by fine, persistent tannins. Enjoy now–2024.

title: Domaine Saint Amant 2016 Grangeneuve Red (Beaumes-de-Venise)
description: The 2016 Grangeneuve shares the same intensely juicy, primary flavors of black cherry and blueberry preserves as the 2015, but it also has an earthen, herbal complexity that's intriguing. It's plush and rounded with fine, integrated tannins. An elegant, robust wine to enjoy now–2023.

title: Gibbs 2016 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% varietal, value-driven wine that is sanguine and meaty as well as layered in dark plum and currant. Strong and powerful, it has a high-toned, dusty texture that brightens the fruit and earth.

title: Kumeu River 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Kumeu)
description: Kumeu's estate Chard is a blend of six different sites. Despite a few years in bottle, it's still relatively closed, showing a restrained toasty character along with red apple, pineapple and orange rind. The palate is more generous in a satiny texture and seamless backbone of acidity, accompanied by tangy, citrusy flavors and woody undertones. Drink now–2022.

title: Kunde 2015 Heritage Block Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Made from estate-grown fruit, this offers notes of smoked oak and charcuterie on top of a soft, rounded expression of red fruit. The mellow tannins meld seamlessly with the flavors.

title: Lapostolle 2015 Le Rouge Red (Rapel Valley)
description: Ripe, oaky berry aromas are minty and suggest coffee, spice and herb. A flush palate is lush but sort of chunky and broad despite screechy acidity. Black fruit flavors are chocolaty, while this blend of Syrah, Carmenère, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon loses some steam and appeal on an unfocused finish.

title: Lewis Grace 2017 Torrontés (Alta Mesa)
description: This is a bright, snappy, floral and fruity wine that will make a great pre-dinner drink and pair well with seafood and spicy Asian dishes. It's technically dry but so fruity and exuberant that it comes off as a bit sweet.

title: Lion Ranch 2017 Lioness Rosé (Santa Clara Valley)
description: A yellowish shade of pink in the glass, this rosé of 76% Grenache and 24% Cinsaut offers aromas of nectarine, bubblegum and rainy cement. The palate is tense and chalky with a wet stone minerality as well as flavors of pink-peach flesh and lemon peel.

title: Marimar Estate 2015 Don Miguel Vineyard Unfiltered Estate Grown & Bottled Tempranillo (Russian River Valley)
description: Blueberry, mocha and earth highlight this softly textured wine that's made from an estate-grown site and pays homage to the producer's Spanish heritage. It has grip and quiet power.
designation: Don Miguel Vineyard Unfiltered Estate Grown & Bottled

title: Medici Ermete NV Metodo Ancestrale  (Lambrusco di Modena)
description: Wild berry, dried rose, violet and an unusual but intriguing whiff of garrigue lift out of the glass. On the savory, fizzy palate, vibrant acidity supports succulent red cherry, white peach, strawberry, lemon zest and bread dough. It's fun and easy drinking but also loaded with personality.

title: Montirius 2015 Garrigues Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: Mineral and deft on its feet, this ripe but pristine Grenache-Syrah blend has a linear style that's unusual in this robust vintage. Crisp black cherry and berry flavors are concentrated and zesty, marked by hints of bramble, wild thyme and pepper. Ready to drink now but should hold well through 2026.

title: Navarro 2017 Cuvée 128 Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)
description: Brisk and tangy all the way through, this light and refreshing wine was fermented in large oak vats and aged on the lees for four months. It features citrus aromas, lively citrus and crisp apple flavors and a nicely tart texture that livens the palate.

title: Neyen 2014 Espíritu de Apalta Carmenère-Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: Cedary oak and related spice notes control a slumbering nose with lazy berry fruit aromas. A ripe palate is lush but plodding, while drubbing flavors of spiced berry and dark plum are more subdued than lively. Herbal notes and a coffee flavor take over on a weighty finish. This is 50% each Carmenère and Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Nicolas Maillet 2016  Mâcon-Verze
description: This wine has a ripe, dense texture, with good acidity accompanying rich yellow fruits. Full bodied, with a fresh edge and minerality, the wine is totally ready to drink.

title: Pietradolce 2017 Rosso  (Etna)
description: This has inviting aromas of wild berry that mingle with whiffs of wet stone and Mediterranean scrub. The full-bodied, polished palate offers Marasca cherry, ground clove, cured meat and a smoky note alongside a hint of iron. Drink through 2023.

title: Portalupi 2016 Shake Ridge Ranch Barbera (Amador County)
description: This is a pretty, fruity and focused wine that displays good balance and a sleek texture. It offers plenty of red cherry, black cherry and spice accents that are supported by light tannins and tangy acidity.

title: La Gitana 2014 Tradición H  (Rioja)
description: Leathery berry and animal aromas blend nicely into savory plum and berry scents to form a good nose. A tight, drawn-in palate is a bit hard, although there's no complaints with this Rioja's energy level. Saucy, slightly salty tomato and red plum flavors finish with earthy notes. This is a classic Rioja in every sense; drink through 2025.

title: Lava Cap 2017 Rosé (El Dorado)
description: This wine has almost enough color and flavor to be called a red. It shows a deep pink or light ruby color, aromas like rose petals and flavors like black cherry and pomegranate seeds. It's unusual, vivid and fun for adventurous drinkers.

title: Le Clos des Cazaux 2016 La Tour Sarrasine  (Gigondas)
description: Notes of preserved black cherry and berry extend from nose to finish here, muted by savory tones of crushed earth, forest floor and dried rosemary. Full bodied and richly textured, it's a warming, ruddy wine accentuated by ripe, chewy tannins and sunny acidity. Enjoy now–2026.

title: Le Colture NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)
description: This delicious sparkler opens with heady scents of white spring flower, green apple and vanilla that follow through the creamy palate along with white almond. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors while a silky mousse lends elegance and an irresistibly smooth texture.

title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2015 Lieu-dit Verdot  (Bordeaux)
description: One of the exciting wines produced by this go-ahead cooperative in Blaye, this is pure Petit Verdot. Dark in color, packed with firm tannins and impressive black fruits, it is a wine to age for several years. Drink from 2022.

title: Llopart 2012 Gran Reserva Panoramic Imperial Sparkling (Cava)
description: Apple and pear aromas are fairly fresh and bright, not bready or rich. A juicy but mature palate has vitality. Dry, lightly yeasty white fruit flavors are more competent than special or spectacular, while this well-made gran reserva is moderately complex on the finish.

title: Marcel Couturier 2016 Le Bourg  (Pouilly-Loché)
description: This toasty, spicy wine is rich, with a backup of great fruits. The mineral texture gives an edge to the ripeness and brings out the warmth of the vintage. Drink this full-bodied wine now.

title: Matias Wines 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Ripe and fruity aromas of cherry pie with vanilla-laced crust make for a delicious and hedonistic if not entirely complex nose on this appellation blend. It's also rich and fruity on the palate, with black-cherry and warm croissant flavors.

title: Michael David 2016 6th Sense Syrah (Lodi)
description: This lavish wine matches loud oak spice on the nose with equally bold jammy fruit on the full palate, without the tannins becoming too oppressive. It has aromas of vanilla, nutmeg and toasted bread plus tasty blackberry, blueberry and dark-chocolate flavors.

title: Montirius 2015 Le Clos Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: Made from equal proportions Grenache and Syrah, this feisty red blend offers alluring blackberry and mulberry flavors against a perfumed backdrop of violet, rose and bramble. It's silky yet vibrantly balanced, edged by bitter mineral tones and fine, persistent tannins. Enjoy now–2028.

title: Neely 2015 Hidden Block Spring Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Elegantly layered aromas of black cherry, cola, ginger and damp wood show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard in Portola Valley. Baked cherries, nutmeg and clove flavors show strongly on the fuller-bodied palate, with a dried hibiscus finish.

title: Pacific Rim 2016 Solstice Vineyard Riesling (Yakima Valley)
description: The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of lime leaf, herb, pear and flower. Dry, well-balanced fruit flavors follow, backed by lively acidity. Beautiful stuff.

title: Quady 2016 Essensia Orange Muscat (California)
description: This powerful dessert wine offers heady aromas of orange peel, almonds and honey followed by sweet, vibrant and concentrated fruit and nut flavors. It's full bodied, fully sweet but not sugary, and well balanced by acidity.

title: RhonéA 2016 Les Pierres du Vallat  (Gigondas)
description: Primary, profoundly ripe cherry and raspberry flavors are plush and easy on the palate of this full-bodied blend of Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah. Beyond just fruity, however, it's herbal and earthen, too, and balanced by sweet-tart hits of wild strawberry acidity. Ready to drink now but should develop nicely through 2026.

title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Excellence Méthode Traditionnelle Sparkling (Mendocino County)
description: This enticing and supple wine starts with aromas of bread dough and toasted almonds. The palate brings flavors of both fresh and baked apple on a plush, softly sparkling texture.

title: Seguin-Manuel 2015 Petits Noizons  (Pommard)
description: This concentrated wine is balanced and ripe. Its tannins and structure come from the richness of the vintage. This is an age-worthy wine, ripe with black fruits and firmly textured. Drink from 2024.

title: Sheldon 2017 Las Brisas Vineyard Vermentino (Carneros)
description: Made in tiny amounts, this vineyard-designate is stainless-steel fermented and aged and shows a spritzy, nervy personality of freshness and focus. Floral gardenia and jasmine give way to bright, developed flavors of Meyer lemon and blood orange.

title: Terlato 2017 Estate Bottled Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This opens with enticing scents of honeysuckle, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of beeswax. The enveloping palate doles out juicy yellow pear, creamy white peach and a hint of citrus, while a mineral note brightens the finish.

title: Valli 2016 Gibbston Vineyard Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
description: Heading into full-bodied territory by Pinot standards, this wine comes straight out of the gate with aromas of ripe cherry, cola, violet and charred oak. The palate is more dialed down and the fruit less overtly ripe. It's backed by an earthy, herbaceous spine and wrapped in muscular, angular tannins. The oak rears its head, and is a little bitter, on the finish, but there is nevertheless elegance amidst the power. Drink now—2028.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2016 Les Chaniots Premier Cru  (Montagny)
description: This rich wine is full of young fruits that have a spicy edge from wood aging. The floral aroma is enhanced on the palate by almonds, acidity and ripe green-plum flavors. A ripe wine, it will be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Ballard Lane 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Tight aromas of lime, wet stone and bright lemon are quite fresh on the nose of this well-priced wine. There is tension to the palate, carrying flavors of nectarine, white melon and tangy citrus.

title: Barone di Villagrande 2016 Rosso  (Etna)
description: Made with native grapes and aged in chestnut barrels, this fragrant red has intriguing aromas of wild berry, new leather, tobacco, crushed herb and graphite. The vibrant, light-bodied palate offers juicy red cherry, baking spice and star anise alongside lithe, slightly dusty tannins. It closes on a carob note. Drink through 2024.

title: Calyptra 2010 Zahir Cabernet Sauvignon (Cachapoal Valley)
description: Talk about a super herbal Chilean Cabernet; this is loaded with juniper and wild herb aromas, making the nose quite particular. A drying, tannic palate is scratchy at first but then more solid and structured. Minty green-leaning berry and tobacco flavors finish with a return to juniper and spiced berry fruit. Drink through 2020.

title: Château Brûle Sécaille 2016 Grande Réserve  (Côtes de Bourg)
description: A purple-colored, young wine dominated by Merlot, this is rich, structured and full of blackberries. With a good balance between the fruit and the tannins already in place, it shows excellent potential. Drink this already delicious but still firm wine from 2022.

title: Château Finet 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Ripe and balanced, this Yvon Mau wine is full of both tannins and great fruits. It is rich and powerful, the flavors generous and ripe. Blackberries dominate along with balanced acidity. Drink from 2022.

title: Château la Gravière 2015 Cuvée les Terrasses  (Côtes de Bourg)
description: This rich, balanced wine is ripe and juicy. With layers of black fruits and well-integrated tannins, it has a dense texture while also packing a punch of great fruitiness. The fruit and tannins are ripe. This wine will develop well. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Langlais 2015  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion
description: This 30-acre vineyard, 70% Merlot, has produced a balanced, stylish wine. Touches of bitter coffee come from the 15 months in wood, but the main thrust of this developing wine is the ripe black-currant fruitiness. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Pas de l'Ane 2012  Saint-Émilion
description: Almost half-and-half Cabernet Franc and Merlot, this soft, ripe and fruity wine is open and ready to drink. It has some toast that is mainly integrated with the black-currant flavors. As the wine opens, richness, spice and acidity all come together. Drink now.

title: Château Phélan-Ségur 2012 Frank Phélan  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: Frank was the son of Bernard Phélan, who created this estate in the mid 19th century. The second wine of the chateau, it is bold, ripe and judiciously aged in wood, offering great tannins and black fruit. A dense texture, black-plum flavors and perfumed acidity promise a good future. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Richebon 2015  Pauillac
description: A small estate belonging to the owners of classed growth Croizet Bages, this wine is rich, densely textured and has good potential. It is young: both the tannins and the slight barnyard character testify to that. When it matures, it will be full and concentrated. Drink from 2022.

title: Christophe Cordier 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)
description: A full-bodied wine, this is rich and packed with fruits. It is generous in its texture and green-plum and pear flavors. Warm and ripe, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Clos des Rocs 2016 Clos des Rocs Monopole  (Pouilly-Loché)
description: This rich wine has a ripe texture of minerality, spice and delicious apricot and creamed-apple flavors. Made from organic grapes, it is a rounded wine with warmth and fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Domaine de la Verde 2015 Alpha-Omega Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: Lavish streaks of vanilla, cream, toast and spice adorn this ornate blend of Grenache and Syrah. Aged 16 months in 50% new French oak, its embellished style will appeal to lovers of oak, but there's a core of crisp, vivacious black cherry and plum here as well. It's a bit heady now but should ease and gain elegance through 2028.

title: Domaine de Montvac 2015 Cuvée Vincila Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: Bright acidity and luscious fruit meld elegantly in this rich but balanced wine. A blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah, it offers plush black cherry and mulberry flavors accented with lavender and crushed earth. The finish is long and silky, marked by smooth tannins. Drink now–2026.

title: Domaine la Ligière 2016 Les Garennes Grenache-Syrah (Beaumes-de-Venise)
description: This is an intensely ripe yet elegant wine offering succulent mulberry and black plum flavors edged by hints of crushed mineral and dried herb. It's pure in fruit expression and silky on the palate. The finish lingers on fine, feathery tannins. Enjoy now–2025.

title: Domaine le Clos de Caveau 2015 Lao Muse Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: Whiffs of sun-dried hay and earth lend savory accents to profoundly ripe flavors of cherry and strawberry preserves. A blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah, it's rolling and rich on the palate but balanced by sunny acidity and fine, sinewy tannins. Enjoy now–2025.

title: Domaine Perraud 2015  Mâcon La Roche Vineuse
description: This is a ripe, toasty wine with rich yellow fruits and a smooth texture. Now totally mature, this is delicious, full and ready to drink.

title: Domaine Saint Amant 2015 Grangeneuve Red (Beaumes-de-Venise)
description: A very rich, primary wine full of mulberry and black cherry flavors. It's delightfully soft and easy drinking but lifted by bright acidity and framed by firm, persistent tannins. An elegant but forward wine to enjoy now–2026.

title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2015 Légende  (Pauillac)
description: If anybody could source good fruit in Pauillac, it would be the winemaking team at Lafite-Rothschild. This wine, with its classic black-currant flavors, is structured while full of the ripe fruitiness and rounded character of the vintage. Drink from 2019.

title: Domus Aurea 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Aromas of wild brush and herbal berry fruit include notes of leather and juniper. On the palate, this is more lugubrious and syrupy than in the past. Blackened berry, chocolate and charred flavors precede a finish with lingering burnt toast flavors and excess weight. Drink now; this lacks the acidity and structure for aging.

title: Saracina 2017 Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Intriguing pine-needle and white-pepper aromas lead to lean flavors of lemon and green apple in this light-bodied, crisp wine. It's a refreshing antidote to the overly buttery, oaky options.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Estate Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)
description: There's a strong stony aroma on the nose of this well-shaped bottling, along with Meyer lemon pith and dried nectarine elements. The palate is streamlined with yellow-peach and citrus-peel flavors, with a full mouthfeel that is leveled by balanced acidity and a firm texture.

title: Tenuta Montemagno NV TM Brut 24 Metodo Classico Barbera (Vino Spumante)
description: Made with 100% Barbera grapes, this intriguing sparkler opens with aromas of dried rose petal, sandalwood and a whiff of bread dough. On the airy, elegant palate, fresh acidity brightens wild cherry, pomegranate, vanilla and a hint of white almond. A creamy perlage lends elegance.

title: Tenuta San Guido 2016 Le Difese Red (Toscana)
description: Made with 70% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Sangiovese, this offers enticing aromas of black-skinned berry, iris and cedar. The savory, balanced palate delivers red currant, dried black cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Tower 15 2016 The Swell Red (Central Coast)
description: This blend of 33% Merlot, 27% Petit Verdot, 27% Cabernet Sauvignon and 13% Cabernet Franc comes from both Paso Robles and Santa Barbara County vineyards. It shows aromas of elderberry, leather, dried leaves and cappuccino on the nose. It's lush in texture on the palate, where baked blackberry, charred meat and espresso bean flavors arise.

title: Viaggio 2014 Little Missy Estate Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Great concentration helps this full-bodied wine stand out. It has intense and ripe blackberry and raspberry flavors, moderate tannins and good length on the finish.

title: Union de Producteurs de Saint-Émilion 2015 Château Capet Duverger  (Saint-Émilion)
description: Generous, rich and with powerful tannins that are cushioned by ripe black-currant fruits, this is already an attractive wine. Its black fruits, acidity and wood-aging spice are gently integrating, offering the potential for aging. Drink from 2022.

title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2017 Terroirs  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: Fresh apple flavors dominate this crisp wine. It has bright acidity and a lively texture that is lightly perfumed and full of acidity. The mineral texture keeps the wine together and balanced. Drink now.

title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Château Fortuneau  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This richly structured wine is powered by its tannins and ripe black fruits. The concentration of its structure is impressive, with a rich density to the black-plum flavors. This is a wine for aging, ready to drink from 2023.

title: Albert Bichot 2016 Domaine du Pavillon  (Meursault)
description: Produced from one of this negociant's own vineyards, this wine is on the generous side of Meursault. Richness, fruitiness and touches of wood aging are balanced with the crisper, mineral texture that will let the wine age. Drink from 2020.

title: Au Bon Climat 2016 Los Alamos Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Warm almond, white peach and sweet oak aromas show on the nose of this wine from legend Jim Clendenen. There is solid tension to the palate, where edgy flavors of lemon skin are balanced by the warmth of hazelnut.

title: Barone di Villagrande 2014 Contrada Villa Grande  (Etna)
description: Dark-skinned berry, baking spice, new leather and rose aromas come together in the glass. It's light-bodied and ethereally elegant, offering raspberry, dried cherry, clove and ferrous minerals framed by lithe, slightly drying tannins. Drink through 2026.

title: Betz Family 2016 La Serenne Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)
description: The aromas start out brooding, opening up to reveal notes of fresh and dried herb, smoke, dark coffee bean, iron and smoked meat, focusing mostly on the savory. The flavors are light, deft, and elegant, displaying enough structure to reward a bit of time in the cellar. Those looking for a big, bold expression of this variety and vineyard should look elsewhere. This one is all about finesse.

title: Calera 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: The nose of this wine is sharp and precise in tones of chalk, tangerine cream, dried lemon and crushed nuts. There's a strong mineral quality through the entire palate that accents flavors of lemon juice and yellow pear.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2016 Les Hauts Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: Still young, this crisp wine has a mineral texture and tight acidity. Along with the toastiness and spice, it is structured to age. Drink this rich, full wine from 2020.

title: Château Fleur Haut Gaussens 2016 La Bergeronnette Cabernet Franc  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: An immediately attractive, perfumed wine with fine tannins and rich berry fruits, this has great potential. It is full, ripe and will age well. Just wait until 2022.

title: Château Jalousie Beaulieu 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: The fruit is right up front in this ripe, full wine. With fine tannins and a rich texture, it is spicy, toasty and packed with blackberry fruits. Acidity shows strongly at the end. Along with the tannins, this will allow it to age. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Pey la Tour 2016 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: Packed with tannins, this is a dark, dense wine. Its impressive structure frames rich blackberry and plum fruits. Let this wine age for several years and don't drink before 2022.

title: Collin-Bourisset 2017  Viré-Clessé
description: Fresh, fruity and with an attractive balance between acidity and richness, this wine is well textured. Its crisp character brings out citrus as well as ripe apples and pineapple flavors. Drink the wine now.

title: Cuda Ridge 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This impressive and full-bodied wine has powerful fruit and subdued oak flavors held tightly by a firm structure. Vivid black cherry and sour cherry unfold on the palate while light accents of dark chocolate and clove are layered in. Fine-grained tannins are abundant, but should mellow by 2023.

title: Clos La Soleya NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Stale fruit aromas and a flat palate extinguish hopes of this being anything more than basic Cava. Fruit bowl flavors of apple, mango and lemon-lime lose clarity and quality the longer one spends with this. Chill and kill for best results.

title: Errazuriz 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Costa)
description: A pinched, briny nose is punchy and includes aromas of citrus peel. A narrow palate is tight but low on depth, while this tastes peppery and green, with little fruit character. On the finish, bitter green flavors are once again lacking in fruit.

title: Hayes Valley 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has lots of jammy aromas and flavors but also a dry palate impression and enough tannin and acidity to give it a lean finish.

title: Paul Cheneau NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny, herbaceous aromas are strained and pickled. This brut rosé has a highly regular mouthfeel and briny flavors of orange and spent yeast. A flat finish tastes mostly of lightly pickled red cabbage.

title: Pedernales 2016 Reserve Viognier (Texas)
description: Aromas of warm sugar cookie and baked pear carry the nose. The palate offers a bit more freshness in flavors of apple, lemon and hints of creamed butter and vanilla. The finish brings Bosc pear and lemon pith.

title: Santa Ema 2016 Amplus Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Alto)
description: Soapy plum aromas are creamy and unconvincing. Oddly, this oaky Cabernet is raw, tart and crisp in feel. Citric flavors are zesty at first, then falsely buttery. High acidity, marginal fruit and lots of oak amount to something just O.K.

title: The Federalist 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine is brimming in blackberry and vanilla flavors, with an earthy quality that rides below the intensity of the fruit. The acidity is elusive.

title: Totus Tuus NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Apple and brioche notes are tellingly not fresh. In the mouth, this is decidedly flat in feel. Flavors of buttered toast and pear show no zip on a tired finish.

title: Undurraga 2016 Sibaris Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Generic berry aromas are oaky, while overall not much is happening with the nose. A flush, grabby palate is bulky and low on charm, while this tastes of murky, herbal berry fruits. A tannic finish ends with a thud.

title: Albamar 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)
description: Burnt aromas of rubber and tires along with generic black fruit notes are somewhat harsh. This feels hard and rubbery, with limited roasted berry fruit flavors. A chunky finish with just enough acidic kick concludes this functional Cabernet.

title: Château Franc Couplet 2016  Bordeaux
description: This wine is soft, fruity and likely to be ready to drink soon. Its red fruits and acidity are already attractive. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Haut Clary 2016  Bordeaux
description: Red berry fruits dominate this young wine. While it has a firm structure, the attractiveness of the fruit and acidity give it the potential to age quickly. Drink this wine from 2020.

title: Château Léon 2017 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Just outside the city of Bordeaux, this vineyard has produced a soft, fruity wine with a pepper and caramel flavor. Light acidity and a soft texture make the wine drinkable now.

title: Château l'Orangerie 2017 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Lightly caramel flavored, this wine is soft, with red-berry fruits and pleasant acidity. Smoothly textured, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Gran Verano 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)
description: Saucy, jumbled berry aromas are satisfactory but not very fresh or lively. A lean, choppy palate holds flavors of red plum, green herb and spice. This boxed wine is totally drinkable but about as basic as basic gets.

title: Lelia 2015 Garnacha-Syrah (Cariñena)
description: Reedy red fruit aromas are candied and slightly raisiny. This blend of Garnacha and Syrah feels fleshy, unfocused and tannic. Jammy strawberry and raspberry flavors are green and chocolaty, while this tastes minty and herbal on an overly tannic finish.

title: Michael Pozzan 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a mild wine that tastes gritty on the palate and sizable in tannin. The fruit is a mix of strawberry and blueberry with teases of baking spice.

title: Three Pears 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has mild fruit aromas, a very soft texture and fruity, almost sugary flavors. It's a straightforward sipper that could be good for a crowd.

title: Univitis 2016 Rocheterrier  (Bordeaux)
description: One of the brands produced by this large cooperative, this rich wine has an odd earthy character that is less appealing. It is ready to drink.

title: Ca' Rugate NV Fulbio Beo Metodo Classico Brut Garganega (Vino Spumante)
description: Lively and fun, this opens with aromas of white spring flower, white stone fruit and a yeasty whiff of bread dough. Made entirely from Garganega, the tangy palate offers ripe yellow apple, citrus zest and white almond alongside lively bubbles.

title: Calcaneus 2016 Feudo di Mezzo  (Etna)
description: Aromas of toasted oak, oak-driven spice and menthol lead the nose. The tight palate offers sour cherry, clove and white pepper alongside close-grained tannins that give it a drying finish.

title: Cantina Riff 2017 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)
description: Mouthwatering aromas of baked apple, ripe white peach and Bartlett pear follow over to the juicy palate alongside tangy acidity. It closes crisp and clean.

title: Cantina Valpantena 2013 Torre del Falasco  (Amarone della Valpolicella)
description: This opens with aromas suggesting ripe dark-skinned fruit, toasted oak and espresso. The full-bodied palate offers prune, fig and vanilla alongside polished tannins.

title: Canvasback 2015 Grand Passage Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: Blackberry jam and cherry aromas lead to ripe, slightly dried-out-seeming fruit flavors that at times paint around the edges. Somewhat burly tannins back it up. The warmth of the vintage shows itself.

title: Cascina Bric 2014 460 Brut Nature Metodo Classico Nebbiolo (Vino Spumante)
description: Made with native grape Nebbiolo, this racy, copper-colored sparkler has shy aromas suggesting rose, cranberry and citrus that mingle with a whiff of pastry dough. On the vibrant palate, crisp acidity and a lively perlage provide the setting for sour cherry, lemon zest and medicinal herb.

title: Château Curton La Perrière 2016  Bordeaux
description: This wine is tannic and firm with concentration and rich black fruits. It has power and a strong sense of structure. The wine will need some time to develop, so will be best left until 2022.

title: Château de Lescours 2014  Saint-Émilion
description: This wine is packed with blackberry flavors layered with the acidity of the vintage. It's floral, crisp and moving comfortably to maturity. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Landereau 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Still closed but showing the potential of ripe black fruits, this big wine is concentrated, with a dry, firm core. Drink this powerful wine from 2022.

title: Château Pabus 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Ripe and spicy, this rich wine has layers of wood accents laid over red-berry flavors that are still developing. The wine has potential for aging, As it softens, it will be rich and delicious. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Roc de Minvielle 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This is a soft, perfumed wine with mint aromas and spicy flavors. The wood aging shows strongly but so does the fruit. The wine should be attractive and ready to drink from 2021.

title: Château Roques Mauriac 2016 Grand Vin  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: Although there is initially too much wood, the black fruits are beginning to have their moment as they push through that dark structure. The wine is still firm with a dry core that needs to soften. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Siran 2016 Saint Jacques de Siran  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This spicy wine with firm tannins is setting out well. Black-currant flavors are balanced with generous tannins and a rich character that will give the wine a full and juicy character. Drink from 2022.

title: Convento Oreja 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Damp but stout aromas of concentrated berry fruits are full but not overly expressive, layered or complex. A fleshy, widespread palate follows suit, while this tastes of jammy but generic plum and berry fruits. A full finish spreads out but lacks definition.

title: Cosa Obra 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Big in style and somewhat reductive, this wine offers funky earthiness and plenty of spearmint, clove and forest floor. It has a softness to the midpalate that reveals fruity flavors of black cherry and blueberry with a lasting note of cola.

title: Covides NV Ferriol Sparkling (Cava)
description: Lime and green herb aromas are fresh and direct. This offers good texture, a medium-full body and proper acidity, all of which help to frame lightly salty and briny nectarine flavors. Overall, this is bright, solid and lively.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2014 Stone Patch Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)
description: Bright cherry and cranberry aromas and equally vivid and crisp fruit flavors dominate this medium- to full-bodied wine. It has a firm texture of tannins and acidity and a mature mellow spicy character that develops in the mouth.

title: Delibori 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella
description: Aromas of mature dark fruit, wet soil and tobacco lead the nose. The linear palate offers raisin, cooking spice and nutmeg alongside close-grained tannins.

title: Domaine Michel Briday NV Stéphane Briday  (Crémant de Bourgogne)
description: This is an attractively soft and fruity wine, full of creamed-apple and citrus flavors. A blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Noir and Aligoté, it is soft, with light acidity and an easygoing refreshing character. Drink now.

title: Domaine Sophie Cinier 2017 A la Côte  (Saint-Véran)
description: This warm, ripe wine offers layers of rich tropical fruits coupled with acidity that balances the richness. The wine is still young, with touches of toastiness and plenty of acidity. It will age well; drink from 2019.

title: Saucelito Canyon 2015 1880 Old Vine Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Intense aromas of black fruit, savory meats and dried flowers provide a complex entry to the nose of this wine, which comes from vines planted in 1880. Buoyant acidity and ample structure uphold the palate, where bright flavors of blackberry and elderberry meet with mocha and anise.

title: Selvapiana 2013 Villa Petrognano Red (Pomino)
description: A blend of 60% Sangiovese, 20% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, this has alluring, earthy aromas of new leather, tobacco and ripe black-skinned berry. On the smooth palate, fresh acidity brightens juicy raspberry, Marasca cherry, orange zest, star anise and eucalyptus. Polished tannins lend elegant support. Drink through 2025.

title: Small Vines 2016 Estate Cuvée Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Fresh and forested, this wine has tannin weight and spice to match and complement buzzy acidity and ongoing freshness in the glass. With 35% new French oak, it allows the pomegranate-tangy fruit and Asian spice to take turns speaking.

title: Te Mata 2015 Elston Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)
description: From one of the oldest grape growing sites in New Zealand and from a relatively ripe, concentrated vintage, this wine shows all of the complex and intense fruit notes you would expect. A mélange of stone fruit and pineapple aromas are bolstered by touches of honey and butterscotch. The palate is creamy and full, but its life raft is the tangy, almost crunchy acidity.
